methods.name: parseSignature
methods.comment:
Parse the given function signature text.  Any exceptions will be handled herein
 by showing an error dialog (null is returned in that case).

params.name: serviceProvider
params.comment: the service provider used to access DataTypeManagers

params.name: program
params.comment: the program against which data types will be resolved

return.comment: the data type that is created as a result of parsing; null if there was a problem

methods.name: parseSignature
methods.comment:
Parse the given function signature text.  Any exceptions will be handled herein
 by showing an error dialog (null is returned in that case).

params.name: service
params.comment:
the service used to access DataTypeManagers or null to use only the program's
 data type manager.

params.name: program
params.comment: the program against which data types will be resolved

return.comment: the data type that is created as a result of parsing; null if there was a problem

methods.name: parseSignature
methods.comment:
Parse the given function signature text.  Any exceptions will be handled herein
 by showing an error dialog (null is returned in that case).

params.name: service
params.comment:
the service used to access DataTypeManagers or null to use only the program's
 data type manager.

params.name: program
params.comment: the program against which data types will be resolved

params.name: handleExceptions
params.comment:
true signals that this method should deal with exceptions, 
        showing error messages as necessary; false signals to throw any encountered
        parsing exceptions.  This allows clients to perform exception handling that
        better matches their workflow.

return.comment: the data type that is created as a result of parsing; null if there was a problem

methods.name: handleParseProblem
methods.comment:
Given a throwable, attempt pull out the significant error parts to generate a 
 user-friendly error message.

params.name: t
params.comment: the throwable to examine, originating from the CParser.

params.name: functionString
params.comment: the full function signature text that was parsed by the parser.

return.comment:
a user-friendly error message, or null if this class did not know how to 
         handle the given exception.
